content.question: Based on the short-run production function graph above showing the relationship between the quantity of labor and total product, which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: The marginal product of labor is always increasing.

At <math alttext="L sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>L</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> the marginal product of labor is at its maximum.
Total product is maximized when marginal product is zero.

At <math alttext="L sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>L</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> the marginal product of labor exceeds the average product of labor.
The marginal product of labor is always positive.

content.answer: Total product is maximized when marginal product is zero.
